Title: Adanggaman
Writer: Jean-Marie Adiaffi, Bertin Akaffou, Roger Gnoan M'Bala, Christophe Pellet (adaptation)
Actors: Rasmané Ouédraogo, Albertine N'Guessan, Ziable Honoré Goore Bi, Bintou Bakayoko
Plot: In West Africa during the late 17th century, King Adanggaman leads a war against his neighboring tribes, ordering his soldiers to torch enemy villages, kill the elderly and capture the healthy tribesmen to sell to the European slave traders. When his village falls prey to one of Adanggaman's attacks, Ossei manages to escape, but his family is murdered except for his captured mother. Chasing after the soldiers in an effort to free her, Ossei is befriended by a fierce warrior named Naka.
Country: France, Switzerland, Côte d'Ivoire, Burkina Faso, Italy
